Key Match Events: West Indies defeated Papua New Guinea by 5 wickets
Rovman Powell's side chased the target in 19 overs on the back of sixth-wicket stand between Roston Chase and Andre Russell
West Indies had a jitter in the run chase as they lost five wickets for 97 runs and needed 40 off the last four overs
Roston Chase kept his nerves and steered the home side to a win with not out 27-ball 42. Rusell supported with nine-ball 15*
Miscellaneous Highlights: Earlier, West Indies didn't allow PNG to settle early as they kept taking wickets at regular intervals and restricted them on 136-8 after opting to bowl first
The only notable partnership PNG had was of Sese Bau and Charles Amini for the fifth wicket where they scored 44 runs which gave them some momentum
Andre Russell was the pick of the bowlers, bagging figures of 2.19 while Alzarri Joseph took 2/34
Kiplin Doriga (27*) chipped in with some vital runs at the backend to take the total to 136/8
Others: Johnson Charles, Brandon King, Nicholas Pooran, Assad Vala (2 wickets), Romario Shepherd, Akeal Hosein, Tony Ura, Assad Vala, Sese Bau, Hiri Hiri, Charles Amini, Kipling Doriga, Alei Nao, Chad Soper, Kabua Morea, John Kariko
